"...Whatever..."
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): "...Whatever..."
By Nate Railsback on Thursday, November 1, 2001 - 11:03 pm:

My Zan is not greatly impressing me. If I'd known that it would have this "All signs point to me not giving a rat's @$$" attitude, I would have named it Squall instead of Jedah. I went through the process of turning it from a pure Zan into a Retsu, which seems to have resulted in a shorter lifespan and a "Harder" training style that I can't seem to shake, because this thing doesn't care for any of the food I give it. It really does have only a 1 or 2 for "Favorite" in all foods. I originally thought it was because of the "Calm" characteristic, but now that it's evolved it's lost it, and it continues to be a punk. It failed constantly in its early days, it gets tired easily even when raised in its own environment, and what's more, Retsu apparently have Tough Skin. This does not work particularly well with a speed demon. I gave it the heart of my champion Usazo, Ravage (It was like a messed-up version of the Monty Python and the Holy Grail killer rabbit! It rocked!), and its realiability seems to have improved since, but I'm still unable to shake this "Harder" treatment that seems to be slowly killing it. Any calls?

By torey_luvullo on Friday, November 2, 2001 - 06:54 am:

having never raised a zan, i can only give general advice which may or may not help:

1] give a large egg. just on general principles.

2] try switching to one of the softer responses [great job for great/ even a no big deal for failures] to try to get it down to normal.

3] try switching areas, and watching for subtle hints on the animations that it likes that area better.

4] just go ahead, raise its stats, to hell with its pleasure and lifespan, grab the heart and chalk it up to experience.

well, that does it for my bag of tricks, pitiful as it may be...

By Nate Railsback on Friday, November 2, 2001 - 04:12 pm:

I've determined that Large Eggs only work on physical problems, as well they should. Mental problems (Vegetarian, Pride, Eats Anything, etc.) don't vaporize with the Egg.

By Trickster on Saturday, November 3, 2001 - 06:31 pm:

Out of curiosity Nate, it doesn't have the "eats anything" characteristic, does it? That'd cause all the foods to be around two on "favorite." (Eats anything is an especial pain combined with "vegetarian" by the way... *sigh*)

As for getting the training style down from harder... I wouldn't worry THAT much about it (remember that there's a mistranslation, and "harder" is easier on it than "hard").. but if you really want to lose it, try seeing what it likes. I'd suggest trying a black pearl, or maybe coral. Then give that to it every so often, just as a reward, or a gift, or what have you. That should help smooth things over for you.
